info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 3:27AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Spotty Critical Fire Weather Conditions This Afternoon... Warmer air temperatures, returning dry air, along with very strong winds will lead to spotty critical fire weather conditions across eastern Fremont, southern El Paso, and Pueblo counties this afternoon. These areas did receive some snow over the last day or two, with fuels likely not critical over parts of the counties. Relative humidity values are expected to be at or just below 15 percent though, with very strong northerly winds gusting to 60 to 70 mph developing by mid morning and lasting through the afternoon. Conditions may be favorable for rapid fire spread and growth, and activities which could start a fire should be avoided today.
